summary: "The School of Athens" is a famous painting by Raphael, created between 1509 and 1511 for the Pope's rooms in the Vatican. It shows many ancient thinkers and scientists, with Plato and Aristotle in the middle. Identifying most figures is tricky, but some are thought to be Socrates, Pythagoras, and famous artists Leonardo da Vinci (as Plato) and Michelangelo (as Heraclitus). Raphael even included himself. The painting is special for its realistic perspective and its celebration of ancient Greek ideas, which were important during the Renaissance. It's considered one of Raphael's best works.
title: The School of Athens
